title: Block stolen Pixel (carrier says responsibility is on manufacturer)
content:
I got my phone stolen and the industry seems very connivant and relaxed with this situation.

I called the carrier which says that products bought to Google from their own Google Store cannot be blocked through IMEI by them, that I should call Google to block it... 

But Google only has a very few insufficient options that are only about blocking thieves from reading data.

What is the phone number or the way that I can contact Google so they block their own product so at least this makes more difficult for thieves to benefit from this situation?
